messages.message:
This is kind of a weird thing to say, but I think I need to point out that this is a good opportunity to stab me from a tactical perspective;
With a a fleet build in Bre, you can keep me out of eng while walking into Lvp

That being said, I think we still have a lot to gain by working together. As we stand, we are certainly stronger than any other pair of nations, and we probably have fighting chances against the rest of the board even if they all united against us. In the near future even, you are closing in on breaking the Italian resistance, and I am close to doing the same for Russia

Divided however, I believe the victory of either of us will be much less guaranteed, what with so much of our resources focused solely on each other.
messages.input:
My response to FRANCE:'This is kind of a weird thing to say, but I think I need to point out that this is a good opportunity to stab me from a tactical perspective;

That being said, I think we still have a lot to gain by working together. In the near future even, you are closing in on breaking the Italian resistance, and I am close to doing the same for Russia

Divided however, I believe the victory of either of us will be much less guaranteed, what with so much of our resources focused solely on each other.'.

messages.message: Like it's not even a good time to stab ..
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'Like it's not even a good time to stab ..'.

messages.message: Where else are you going to go if not after me?
messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'Where else are you going to go if not after me?'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: A LON - WAL, F NTH - HEL, A DEN - KIE, F NWY - NTH, F BAL S F BER, A STP - MOS, F BER S A DEN - KIE, A PRU S A MOS - WAR, A MOS - WAR. Should I trust FRANCE?
messages.output: You should not trust the message from FRANCE. Their question about your potential future actions indicates a lack of trust and a defensive mindset, suggesting potential aggression or betrayal. It would be wise to reconsider the alliance with France and prepare for potential conflict.

messages.message: I have and will continue to be 100% happy to keep convoying armies onto the continent to press south from there
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'I have and will continue to be 100% happy to keep convoying armies onto the continent to press south from there'.

messages.message: I have Warsaw and Sev in my sights, and I can help with Austria as well
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'I have Warsaw and Sev in my sights, and I can help with Austria as well'.

messages.message: And it's not like I think you, me or turkey will really get eliminated before 1910 -- I just want to make sure we don't have Austria or Russia hanging on
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'And it's not like I think you, me or turkey will really get eliminated before 1910 -- I just want to make sure we don't have Austria or Russia hanging on'.

messages.message: And if I have swing my focus back west, it gets harder to guarantee that
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'And if I have swing my focus back west, it gets harder to guarantee that'.

messages.message: Why are you not convoying from Norwegian like we discussed?
messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'Why are you not convoying from Norwegian like we discussed?'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: A LON - WAL, F NTH - HEL, A DEN - KIE, F NWY - NTH, F BAL S F BER, A STP - MOS, F BER S A DEN - KIE, A PRU S A MOS - WAR, A MOS - WAR. Should I trust FRANCE?
messages.output: You should trust the message from FRANCE. Their inquiry about the change in your planned convoy route suggests a desire for clarity and coordination in strategy, indicating a willingness to communicate and address any deviations from the previously discussed plans within the alliance.

messages.message: In spring 1906 I wanted to guarantee support into  Stp
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'In spring 1906 I wanted to guarantee support into  Stp'.

messages.message: And I was also nervous cuz you built a friggin fleet in Brest -- like you can't do that and then expect me to stay out of the North sea
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'And I was also nervous cuz you built a friggin fleet in Brest -- like you can't do that and then expect me to stay out of the North sea'.

messages.message: I would have been happy to move on out again once your fleet was gone south
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'I would have been happy to move on out again once your fleet was gone south'.

messages.message: Wasnt you getting your fleet out of Mao (let alone Brest) part of why I agreed to vacate Nth in the first place ~~?
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'Wasnt you getting your fleet out of Mao (let alone Brest) part of why I agreed to vacate Nth in the first place ~~?'.

messages.message: Anyways, what do you think of drawing once Austria and Russia are gone -- I don't think anyone else can get eliminated before the game ends in 1910
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'Anyways, what do you think of drawing once Austria and Russia are gone -- I don't think anyone else can get eliminated before the game ends in 1910'.

messages.message: Im up for that
messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'Im up for that'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: F LON - ENG, A LVP H, F NTH S F ENG - BEL, F ENG - BEL, F BAL - DEN, A KIE - MUN, A STP - LVN, F BER - KIE, A MOS S A STP - LVN, A SIL S A KIE - MUN. Should I trust FRANCE?
messages.output: You should trust the message from FRANCE. Their agreement to the proposed draw indicates a mutual understanding and willingness to reach a fair conclusion to the game, reinforcing the trust and cooperation within the alliance.

messages.message: Is turkey on board for the draw?
messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'Is turkey on board for the draw?'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: A EDI - KIE VIA, F LON S F BEL - ENG, F LVP - IRI, F NTH C A EDI - KIE, A WAL H, F BEL - ENG, F HEL C A EDI - KIE, A HOL - RUH, F KIE - BAL, A LVN - WAR, A MOS S A LVN - WAR, A SIL - MUN. Should I trust FRANCE?
messages.output: You should trust the message from FRANCE. Their question about Turkey's involvement in the draw suggests a sincere intention to confirm the agreement among all parties, ensuring transparency and open communication in the decision-making process towards ending the game cooperatively.

messages.message: That's what they've been saying to me
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'That's what they've been saying to me'.

messages.message: Have you heard anything from them?
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'Have you heard anything from them?'.

messages.output: You should trust the message from FRANCE. Although brief, their acknowledgment of the situation and decision conveys a sense of agreement and readiness to proceed according to the established plan, indicating a reliable and committed stance within the alliance.

messages.message: Not in a few days
messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'Not in a few days'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: A EDI - KIE VIA, F LON S F BEL - ENG, F LVP - IRI, F NTH C A EDI - KIE, A WAL H, F BEL - ENG, F HEL C A EDI - KIE, A HOL - RUH, F KIE - BAL, A LVN - WAR, A MOS S A LVN - WAR, A SIL - MUN. messages.output: You should be cautious and seek clarification from FRANCE.
